text:
e="preserve">William Goldwyn "Bill" Nunn III (October 20, 1953 – September 24, 2016) was an American actor. He was known for his roles as Radio Raheem in Spike Lee's movie "Do the Right Thing" and Robbie Robertson in the Sam Raimi "Spider-Man" movie trilogy. He was born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
Nunn died of leukemia at his home in Pittsburgh's Hill District on September 24, 2016, aged 62.
